author: michaels_afol
title: A Transitional Oddity
review:
1978 was an exciting year for Lego, with the launch of the minifigure and the new Legoland Town theme. This set was one of the less notable in that new theme.

It's not a terrible set, but curiously out of place amongst the other sets released that year. No minifig is included, not that they could have ridden in the helicopter anyway. But there were many other sets released that year where a minifig was included but they couldn't ride in the vehicle.

This set wouldn't have been out of place in the previous Legoland theme, in fact it looks similar to 618 Police Helicopter released the previous year. It is something of a throwback to the previous era when Lego was moving rapidly forward.

author: peti7788
title: Promotional Heli
review:
I also don’t understand why this set got into the town theme. I think this is also a promotional set as we don’t get a minifigure and it wouldn’t even fit in the helicopter. Which is pretty sad. The gaming experience is thus quite limited. 

But to say something good too, I specifically like that tail part chick is a 1 brick wide.

Incidentally, this set was once again released in America in the early 1980s as 6626 sets.

Overall opinion

If this set had been released in the early 1970s, it would have fit perfectly into the Legoland theme, but is thus pretty useless without a minifigure.

My Mod

I was wondering if I could build better than this set, from the parts available in 1978, and the answer is yes. The UH 1 and Westland Lynx helicopters were quite common at the time, so I was trying to build something like that. You can already put a minifigure in it, and it doesn’t consist of many parts either.

I put a car door in it to have a small storage area that would fit, for example, for a 1x2 tile that symbolizes the first aid kit.

And I solved the engine detail with a gray cylindrical brick, which I pressed into a red 1x2 technic brick.

At first, I wanted to use this helicopter design idea to improve the 575 set, but there I preferred to make a Sea King style helicopter.
